snippet.textDisplay: Amazing game. I’ve played ALL, and I mean ALL the soulslike games (even the surge and the surge 2, try them out if you haven’t) and this is easily one of my top five, just below black myth quality imo, however I haven’t beaten the game yet and I’m not terribly far into it so I can’t fully say that yet, but Wu Kong did raise a high bar, so far though this game meets it.

snippet.textDisplay:
You can also buy cleanse potions from the bard who you would actually meet in the forgotten Temple before you unlock the blacksmith for the consumables, making it more beginner friendly. 

On top of that he also sells an item for $3,000 coins that allow you to retrieve lost souls upon death after you die, making it a get out of jail free card if you make a mistake
snippet.textOriginal:
You can also buy cleanse potions from the bard who you would actually meet in the forgotten Temple before you unlock the blacksmith for the consumables, making it more beginner friendly. 

On top of that he also sells an item for $3,000 coins that allow you to retrieve lost souls upon death after you die, making it a get out of jail free card if you make a mistake

snippet.textDisplay:
My old arthritic hands and slowed down reaction times from you know, old. This game is brutal!!! But man I'm loving it. I'm not a parry or block kinda a guy. I beat all soulslikes by dodging and over leveling a bit to compensate for, old. This game forces me to play outside of my comfort zone and though it is hard and not even at viper yet. And it literally hurts to play. I'm loving it!!! 


Side note. I'm always seeing people say "oh another souls like" like yeah dude. Another one. Please more and more and more!! Would you rather them stop making them?? This type of game should be made all the time so we can choose the good ones. If none were there. None to choose.

snippet.textDisplay: One good tip, if you check your bestiary (I forget the name if it) there are certain enemies with challenges you can get rewards for completing. I'm enjoying the game, but I noticed the levels are pretty easy and then the boss will absolutely stomp me and it takes me an hour to learn the moveset.  I wish the two were a little more balanced.  Make regular enemies more of a challenge and don't require near perfection for bosses.  

Maybe my vitality is too low.  I'm not sure.

snippet.textDisplay: Great video❤
snippet.textOriginal: Great video❤

snippet.textDisplay:
I have to say, I am not a fan of the direction of Soulslike games. They have given up on armor and posie and are quickly devolving into elaborate quick time events. Use the right attack or parry at the right time or failed. It really is devolving into Dragons Lair from 40 years ago with a few more options.

For instance, I expected hit boxes to have reached a point to where maybe not fully dodging or perfectly blocking an attack would lead to further combat options. Instead, games are just either you perfectly dodged or you didn't and the combos and intricacies of them increases. It's still extremely binary with zero innovation available to the player. Memorize a dozen different boss patterns and perform the required button presses. It's really bad in my opinion. 

Bosses and enemies having perfect hit tracking is a terrible design philosphy that disappeared from games over a decade ago for a reason. The Ninja Gaiden games eventually failed for a reason. The game industry is recycling dated gameplay.
snippet.textOriginal:

Use the right attack or parry at the right time or failed. It really is devolving into Dragons Lair from 40 years ago with a few more options.

For instance, I expected hit boxes to have reached a point to where maybe not fully dodging or perfectly blocking an attack would lead to further combat options. Instead, games are just either you perfectly dodged or you didn't and the combos and intricacies of them increases. It's still extremely binary with zero innovation available to the player. Memorize a dozen different boss patterns and perform the required button presses. It's really bad in my opinion. 

Bosses and enemies having perfect hit tracking is a terrible design philosphy that disappeared from games over a decade ago for a reason. The Ninja Gaiden games eventually failed for a reason. The game industry is recycling dated gameplay.

snippet.textDisplay: I love how this game motivates and reswards you to grind bosses. Phantom blade is when the game clicked for me and I understood what it was about. This is the first game thay gives you that anime feeling but it will take lots of work to feel like a badass. You'll get your ass stomped learning the bosses moves than come back after finally winning to grind gear. It never feels like a waste of time because your always gaining exp even if you lose.
snippet.textOriginal: I love how this game motivates and reswards you to grind bosses. Phantom blade is when the game clicked for me and I understood what it was about. snippet.textDisplay: The one thing I'm very confused with as compared DS/ER/Nioh is when to swap out gear. Do you always want the highest possible Defense rating (if it doesn't ruin your mobility rating) or are set bonuses more important? Or is this one of those where in the base campaign or early-mid  progression you run whatever drops for you and only worry about gear and stats in late game / NG+? In other Souls you always know cause there suddenly drops a  Titanite for +3 / +4 or the weapons in the area are suddenly +14 instead of your gear level at +13 (like with Nioh).
snippet.textOriginal: The one thing I'm very confused with as compared DS/ER/Nioh is when to swap out gear. Or is this one of those where in the base campaign or early-mid  progression you run whatever drops for you and only worry about gear and stats in late game / NG+? In other Souls you always know cause there suddenly drops a  Titanite for +3 / +4 or the weapons in the area are suddenly +14 instead of your gear level at +13 (like with Nioh).

snippet.textDisplay: I would say one tip is to keep the difficulty to "normal". Yes, it's hard, yes, you will die. But the feeling after beeting a boss is sooo satisfying and why these kind of games is so good in the first place! Though, I love that they included the option to set the difficulty to easy - please try "normal" for a good amount of time first! :)
snippet.textOriginal: I would say one tip is to keep the difficulty to "normal". Yes, it's hard, yes, you will die. But the feeling after beeting a boss is sooo satisfying and why these kind of games is so good in the first place! Though, I love that they included the option to set the difficulty to easy - please try "normal" for a good amount of time first! :)

snippet.textDisplay: The stamina system in slthis game is BAD. Blocking takes stamina, dodging takes stamina, attacks take stamina, getting hit takes stamina. HOW DO I MANAGE MY STAMINA? Game is so fun but when I get to any boss they just beat the stamina out of me. Parry an attack get hit by another, block all the attacks no stamina to counter attack. Like what?
snippet.textOriginal: The stamina system in slthis game is BAD. Blocking takes stamina, dodging takes stamina, attacks take stamina, getting hit takes stamina. HOW DO I MANAGE MY STAMINA? Game is so fun but when I get to any boss they just beat the stamina out of me. Parry an attack get hit by another, block all the attacks no stamina to counter attack. Like what?

snippet.textDisplay: I love this game but the difficulty has ruined it a bit. After approx 70 attempts at killing the Phantom Blade boss I am losing the will. I'm not amazing at games but I've finished all the Soulsborne games and never had this much trouble with any boss. Bit of a shame as I was really loving Khazan until this point.
snippet.textOriginal: I love this game but the difficulty has ruined it a bit. After approx 70 attempts at killing the Phantom Blade boss I am losing the will. I'm not amazing at games but I've finished all the Soulsborne games and never had this much trouble with any boss. Bit of a shame as I was really loving Khazan until this point.

snippet.textDisplay: I’m having a hard time figuring out if this game is for me. I would take a flyer but I’ve done that too often over the past two years and dont really have the money for it at the moment. If anyone has any insight based on the following thoughts please let me know. I loved bloodbourne and the Souls games, Elden ring and Lies of P. I didn’t really enjoy Nioh, Sekiro, Black Myth Wukong. Partly because of the combat style and partly because of skill. The demo for Khazan felt lacking to me but reviews look like there is much more to the game.
snippet.textOriginal: I’m having a hard time figuring out if this game is for me. I would take a flyer but I’ve done that too often over the past two years and dont really have the money for it at the moment. If anyone has any insight based on the following thoughts please let me know. I loved bloodbourne and the Souls games, Elden ring and Lies of P. I didn’t really enjoy Nioh, Sekiro, Black Myth Wukong. Partly because of the combat style and partly because of skill. The demo for Khazan felt lacking to me but reviews look like there is much more to the game.

snippet.textDisplay: Re: Bonus Missions, on PS5, multiple of the trophies earned for finishing NPC stories are gained from doing those side missions, and a bunch of them are bugged, preventing you from earning the trophy. So I've been leaving them for later, waiting for a patch.
snippet.textOriginal: Re: Bonus Missions, on PS5, multiple of the trophies earned for finishing NPC stories are gained from doing those side missions, and a bunch of them are bugged, preventing you from earning the trophy. So I've been leaving them for later, waiting for a patch.

snippet.textDisplay: Brother, you have very informative content and I genuinely appreciate the work you put in to get this information out quickly, but if I may just give a small piece of feedback: potentially consider adding some fluctuation to your voice while reading the script? Hopefully this comes off as genuine feedback and not pointless criticism, as I feel it could elevate the content a lot!
snippet.textOriginal: Brother, you have very informative content and I genuinely appreciate the work you put in to get this information out quickly, but if I may just give a small piece of feedback: potentially consider adding some fluctuation to your voice while reading the script?
